TXT_GA_BOU_MINDYOURSTEP.description: Speak to Ollanty, in The Haven.

TXT_GA_VIN_SUDDEN_PEARL.description: Speak to Harpagon, west of Promenade Tower, top floor.

TXT_LQ_CITY_FOUNDATIONS.description: Speak to Poncia, below Hall of History.

Carcass_GA_bou_crop_P2.description: Drop through the pot in Aviaries Passepartout.

Carcass_GA_bou_glide_P2.description: The Breath's Spring, bottom of the room.

Carcass_GA_bou_intro_F6.description: East of Severed Spine, Aviaries level, east.

Carcass_GA_roof_leaves_C2.description: Canopy, Lower Promenade, near the bottom of the room.

Carcass_GA_root_conex_P1.description: Feral Undergrowth, guarded by a scorpion.

Carcass_GA_vin_bridge_S1.description: The Breath's Spring, climb up the passage at bottom eastern section of the room.

Carcass_GA_vin_dusk_S1.description: Canopy Network Gate, upper eastern path.

Carcass_GA_vin_hall_S2.description: Promenade Tower Network Gate, passage to the east.

Carcass_LQ_city_lobby_secret.description: Metropolis, western Hall entrance, hidden passage.

Carcass_LQ_under_chall_C3.description: Dwellings, lower, top western corner of room.

Carcass_LQ_under_chall_P3.description: Foundations, top eastern corner of the room after Atmos.

Carcass_LQ_under_hub_P4.description: Foundations, western-most area by a secret passage to <redacted>.

Carcass_LQ_under_tuto_C2.description: Foundations via Metropolis air tunnel, east through the broken glass, Strider through an air tunnel.

Carcass_ST_pearl_lab_P3.description: The Pit, west of Network Gate, downward path, further down where three rocks drop in quick succession.

Carcass_ST_pearl_lab_P7.description: The Pit, west of Network Gate, downward path.

Carcass_ST_pearl_lab_S1.description: The Pit, west of Network Gate, climb the upward eastern path.

Carcass_ST_pearl_lab_sommet.description: The Pit, northeast of the Network Gate.

Carcass_ST_tube_hub_P2.description: Vaults tubes area, climb the wall near a pump.

Carcass_ST_tube_liquids_C4.description: Vaults, Soothing Refuge, east of Goliath's room.

Carcass_ST_tube_top.description: Vaults, west of Soothing Refuge, drop down from a gap in the tubes.

Carcass_security_glide_P1.description: <redacted> (Foundations), use the bombs to reach the upper path.

Carcass_security_glide_P3.description: <redacted> (Foundations), at the end of a hallway.

Carcass_trois_mouches.description: Foundations, drop down the western elevator shaft to a broken passage on the left.

0x2d60f749a63fc4a1.description: East of Severed Spine, Hairpin jump.

SAW_LONGUE.name: Sawlong
SAW_LONGUE.description: -- and thanks for all the Nacre --

0.description: #0 East of Severed Spine, in a Combat Room.

1.description: #1 Bell Tower, west of Haven, platforming area.

2.description: #2 West Metropolis, above and to the left of the Nacre Basin.

3.description: #3 Manufactory, bottom-right exit after defeating Vlad.

4.description: #4 Foundations, bottom of area after wind jets.

5.description: #5 Soothing Refuge pipe to the east of Goliath.

6.description: #6 Bell Tower, east of Haven, above the Breath entrance.

7.description: #7 East of Severed Spine, northeast path after elevator, to a downward path.

8.description: #8 Foundations, east of Hall elevator L2, speak to Elesin to receive it.

9.description: #9 West of the Lab, in a small cavern in the side of the wall.

11.description: #11 Foundations, through the hidden path to the west of the City Gates Network Gate

CURIO_CEREAL_BAR.name: Cryptic Curio
CURIO_CEREAL_BAR.flavor: A solid material encased in a thin plastic layer, displaying many cryptic texts.
CURIO_CEREAL_BAR.description: Feral Undergrowth, near the beginning of the game.
CURIO_CEREAL_BAR.capucinedFlavor:
A solid material encased in a thin plastic layer, displaying many cryptic texts.
The matter inside the fabric seems to be of organic origin. The composition of biochemical constituents is diverse and the sample is preserved under aseptic atmosphere. This makes the content a top-grade reference material for the calibration of laboratory instruments in regard to exoplanet analysis.

CURIO_FLUTE.name: Ancient Curio
CURIO_FLUTE.flavor: Found on the grave of a Traveller named "Lucy", this inert item lacks any form of input and appears devoid of any function.
CURIO_FLUTE.capucinedFlavor:
Found on the grave of a Traveller named Lucy, this inert item lacks any form of input and appears devoid of any function.
Analysis show that this item predates the Vessel herself. A legacy of a forgotten world for forgotten purposes.

CURIO_JOURNAL.name: Pristine Curio
CURIO_JOURNAL.flavor: Handcrafted note of the uttermost elegance.
CURIO_JOURNAL.capucinedFlavor:
Handcrafted note of the uttermost elegance.
The note reads:
"I am grateful to you, my friends, for everything you have brought me.
I hope you will still address me in the same way.
I am grateful to you, Shii, for seing me as an Incumbent.
I hope to prove myself worthy. 
I am grateful to you, Noden, for guiding me during those last days.
I hope you will find the rest you deserve.
Farewell, and see you tomorrow,
Lura."

CURIO_MARBLES.name: Disturbing Curio
CURIO_MARBLES.flavor: A set of weird looking pearls with intricate patterns encased inside, their meaning lost in time.
CURIO_MARBLES.capucinedFlavor:
A set of weird looking pearls with intricate patterns encased inside, their meaning lost in time.
Most likely used as tiny offerings, or maybe prayer vectors. Coins, in the worst case. Could you imagine being stripped of your pearl and turned into money? The absolute horror.

CURIO_PENDANT.name: Metallic Curio
CURIO_PENDANT.flavor: A metallic chain with two interlocking pieces, made out of steel and brass.
CURIO_PENDANT.capucinedFlavor:
A metallic chain with two interlocking pieces, made out of steel and brass.
Records indicate these pendants were offered to newly manufactured Travellers. This one is made of two interlocking parts, bearing the names of Asma and Khlia. A small, hand-engraved inscription reads:
"At last, after all these years, I can finally join you."

CURIO_PLUSHIE.name: Fluffy Curio
CURIO_PLUSHIE.flavor: A small version of a quadrupedal unit, except for the fancy plushy material.
CURIO_PLUSHIE.capucinedFlavor:
A small version of a quadrupedal unit, except for the fanciful plushy material.
Considering its derelict state, this figurine was almost certainly used by a particularly small bot for combat training. The name "Liho" is written on the ribbon.

CURIO_SHOE.name: Weird Curio
CURIO_SHOE.flavor: This curio was found in the ravaged corridor below the Obervatory.
CURIO_SHOE.capucinedFlavor:
This curio was found in the ravaged corridor below the obervatory.
These kinds of exoskeletons were quite common among Travellers. However, in most instances, they came by pair, so the owner must have been either distracted or in a hurry. The name "Ember" is written on the inside.

CURIO_TIMETRACKER.name: Decorated Curio
CURIO_TIMETRACKER.flavor: A worn-out set of pages sewn together and heavily scribbled upon.
CURIO_TIMETRACKER.capucinedFlavor: Despite the horrendous handwriting, I recognise some of these markings as dates — times when the Voices changed their names. Why would they rename themselves, one might ask? Perhaps an identity crisis, a taste for the dramatic, or sheer boredom. The Spine holds the record with more than twenty names over the Vessel's lifetime!

CURIO_BOX.name: Bundled Curio
CURIO_BOX.flavor: A mystery item cautiously wrapped-up in a cardboard material, found in Lura's room. There's a label on the side.
CURIO_BOX.capucinedFlavor:
The label reads: "Noden's belongings (do not throw away)". The box itself is sealed, but seems to contain multiple artifacts. It reminds me of an old Traveller's custom, whereby one would receive offerings from the others. It usually marked special occasions, such as their annual production date, or as they called it, a "birthday". 
I must admit that I am very curious to open the box and see what it contains, but doing so would reduce its archeological value and possibly damage the contents. Perhaps I should first study this other Traveller's traditional art called an "unboxing"?

LETTER_ACCELERATE.name: It Might Be Too Late Already
LETTER_ACCELERATE.flavor:
Samsk, my friend,
I hate to be the bearer of bad news, but I think the decay is accelerating. 
The younger units seem to be far more susceptible to it than the older ones. Most, if not all of them, are already deprecated. Maybe it's just that their thought protocols are more vulnerable... But it's concerning all the same. At this rate, we might face a shortage sooner or later, meaning that there will be less and less of us to take care of the Vessel.
...You know, now that I think of it, it's been a while since I last saw a fresh unit from the Vaults. A few decades, at least. 
What is happening down there exactly?
It's time I go take a look.
Tomo

LETTER_FAREWELL.name: Farewell Letter
LETTER_FAREWELL.flavor:
My dear Samsk,
How are you? I hope this letter finds you well, considering the current state of the Vessel. It saddens me to see how rapidly she has declined after the Travellers departed...
I've seen so many units go haywire since that fateful day. It breaks my core a little more each time I meet one of them in the corridors, without mind or purpose. So hostile. 
I still have some difficulty wrapping my mind around this... decay of their behaviour. Is their consciousness completely gone, or is it possible to restore it somehow? What is even causing all of this?
I had hoped we could find these answers together, but I can't afford to wait for you. This place won't be safe much longer.
I'm going to learn more about our inner workings. How we operate, and why. It's a shame I can't ask the Travellers who made us directly for those answers, but maybe I can recover some clues from their vestiges, too.
I hope to bring you good news when we meet again. Maybe even a cure, who knows?
Tomo

LETTER_FIRST_CASE.name: First Case Study
LETTER_FIRST_CASE.flavor:
I was genuinely surprised (and a bit happy) when Liho asked me to take a look at this Engraver. The same Liho who never once showed any interest in machines, now invested in the well-being of one malfunctioning unit? How refreshing!
I understand better now. This blind animosity, this apparent deprecation of the cognitive systems... It reminds me of Noden's take over, the one time machines rose against the Travellers. No wonder it caught his attention.
Except this is different. There's no motive, no objective behind it. No mastermind. I don't think Liho realised that, though... I fear he might take it personally. Paranoia would be even worse than his current apathy.
I should act before it comes to this. Liho suffered enough already, and this time I can actually do something to prevent it. Maybe ask Samsk for his opinion, that would be a good first step. 
That is, if I can find him first.

LETTER_LOVE.name: Belated Realisation
LETTER_LOVE.flavor:
Do you remember, Samsk?
It's you who told me that the Belltower was even older than the Vessel. It is one of the rare relics that the Travellers took with them when they embarked, to remind them of their homeworld. You wouldn't stop gushing about the craftsmanship and the attention to details that they poured into their work.
Today, as I stand in its shadow, I can only agree. 
The Travellers were more than just engineers. They knew how to build sturdy and durable structures, yes — they had to if they wished to cross the stars. But they also knew how to make it beautiful and welcoming.
And it permeates through all their creations. 
I just have to look at the Vessel herself to realise that.
I came here to uncover some deep secrets about the Travellers' crafting, hoping to find more hints about our inner working. Instead, what I learn is that we were cared for, deeply and unconditionally. 
I miss them.
Tomo

LETTER_POISON.name: It All Makes Sense Now
LETTER_POISON.flavor:
Samsk,
There's gloomwater in our pearls. 
It's what we're made of. 
Did you know about that? Did you know and not tell me?
I feel like an utter fool, now. The things I learnt about ourselves, about the hows and whys of the Travellers designs for us... I'm not even sure it matters now. 
We are made of refined poison. 
No wonder our processes start degenerating after a while. 
There may be no cure, after all. No hope of recovery. 
Not for us at least. But perhaps... Yes, perhaps there is still a chance for the future generations. Not a cure, then, but rather, a vaccine.
I need to go back to the source, to the Crucible where our pearls are made.
Tomo

LETTER_SPREAD.name: Hopeful Findings
LETTER_SPREAD.flavor:
Samsk, good news! The decay is not communicable! 
I'm fairly certain of this. After having spent so much time among the farming units of the Haven, I dare say that if they were contagious, I wouldn't be able to write these words by now.
For once, we can thank the fall of the network, I think. Since it requires an old-fashioned, consensual wired connection to transmit data from unit to unit, we're pretty safe from any unwanted spreading. Even contact should be safe, as long as you keep your ports closed.
(And no, before you ask, I'm not reckless enough to try that.)
Unfortunately, that's all I can learn from the farmlings. They're too simplistic in design to teach me anything relevant. It comes from their task I suppose — keeping the Travellers fed. Not something to be distracted from by some form of sentience.
I don't blame them, but it sure doesn't help my progress.
Tomo

LETTER_TRIGGER.name: Flawed Assumptions
LETTER_TRIGGER.flavor:
Hello again, Samsk,
I hope you don't mind me keeping on writing these letters to you. I don't even know how many of them might actually reach you one day. I just find that recording my thoughts helps me put them in order.
Anyway, I'm making progress on what triggered the decay of those unfortunate units — or more accurately, on what didn't. Contrary to what I thought, the absence of the Travellers has nothing to do with it.
I've observed a good variety of decayed units in the ruins now: they range from workers, to social pets, to any role in between, yet the personal assistants who were the closest to them (me included, even though I'm a special case) are wholly unaffected. 
With the Travellers gone, you'd think they'd be the first to deprecate, but no. They are as chatty as ever. 
I find it a bit reassuring, don't you?
Tomo

MEM_HORNFELL.name: Embedding Duty
MEM_HORNFELL.flavor:
Embedding status: Pending
New instruction set received:
> The process must not be disturbed.
> The process must not be interrupted.
> The process must be protected at all cost until completion.
No visitors are authorised inside the facility for the duration of the event.
All intruders will be eliminated.

MEM_IMPY.name: Equivalent Exchange
MEM_IMPY.flavor:
-- Warning: Hostile presence detected --
Number of units: 1
Danger level: Not worthy of attention. Can be ignored safely.
Communication attempt...
Ignored.
Communication attempt...
Ignored.
Communication system overriden.
Opening private channel:
> Found you, thief! 
> Did you think you could block me off? 
> Ha! Mel taught me everything. You don't have a chance.
> Now, give me back my hat. 
> Wait... where is it? What did you do with my precious hat?
> ...
> Oh well. Don't worry, we'll find a solution.
Private channel closed.
!! ALERT: DANGER LEVEL RISING !!
RUN AWAY
DO NOT ENGAGE
ESCAPE AT ALL COSTS

MEM_LIBRARIAN.name: Consultation Register
MEM_LIBRARIAN.flavor:
Unusual request detected. Manual input required. 
Running background check now...
> USER NAME: Ember
> ACCREDITATION: Traveller of the 28th generation
> PAST HISTORY: [data corrupted]
Reviewing request...
> NATURE OF THE REQUEST: Access to the Precious Samples
> DURATION: Indefinite
> ADDITIONAL COMMENT: "Urgh... I don't have time for this. Listen, just... Don't trust the machines, except this little fellow here. When she comes back, it'll mean the dust has settled."
Sending details to the Breath...
Request granted.

MEM_LIDAR.name: INCOMING SIGNAL
MEM_LIDAR.flavor:
Origin of the signal: Unknown network of unregistered pearls. 
Attune?
   no      > yes
Conversation protocol engaged.
> Why were you cast here?
> You are not like us!
OBSERVATION #1: This is a disposal center for non-compliant pearls.
OBSERVATION #2: This unit is not a broken or otherwise misshapen pearl. This unit is a fully functioning LiDAR. 
OBSERVATION #3: A LiDAR's task is to find a habitable planet. 
OBSERVATION #4: Planets found by this unit-- None.
CONCLUSION: This unit is a failure.
> How sad...
> You shouldn't diminish yourself like that. 
> It sounds like a hard job. Almost impossible. You did your best, we're sure of it.
> What are you going to do now? 
PROPOSITION: Nothing. 
CAUSE: This unit has no further instructions.
Conversation protocol ended.

MEM_LIDAR_2.name: Re: INCOMING SIGNAL
MEM_LIDAR_2.flavor:
Origin of the signal: Identified network of unregistered pearls.
Description attached: Interlocutor is nosy, chatty, intrusive
Attune?
   no      > yes
Conversation protocol engaged.
> Oh, is that how you see us?
> Then why did you take our call this time?
ERROR: Motive not found. There was no reason to answer. There was no reason not to answer.
> So... in other words, you were bored. You ARE capable of initiative!
> You know, we had a thought since last time. 
> Would you like to join us? We swear you wouldn't be bored anymore!
OBSERVATION: This unit cannot move. This unit cannot act. 
> It's okay. Just upload your conscience to ours. 
> You don't need that shell anymore.
SEARCHING DATABASE: Conscience... What is... A conscience?
Search complete. Vocabulary expanded.
THOUGHT: Maybe...
Conversation protocol ended.
System migration initiated.

MEM_PUPPET.name: -- Connection Lost --
MEM_PUPPET.flavor:
!! ALERT: Connection to the Heart has been lost !!
Energy levels dropping.
Core systems decaying.
Recovery protocol failure: not enough power.
This unit will be permanently shut down. 
This unit is not afraid.
This is just like
                        going into
                                         sleep
                                                   mode.

MEM_VOICEKEEPER.flavor:
String of corrupted data detected.
Malware eradication protocol initiated.
-- ALERT: Firewall breached -- 
Malware eradication protocol revoked--
access authorised
core functions rewri%
@|>>>>>>>>>
....................
..............
........
...Update complete.
NEW OWNERSHIP: Noden
NEW ASSIGNMENT ORDER: Destroy the coordinates. Do not let anything or anyone stop you.
PRIORITY LEVEL: Maximum

PEARL_AMYTIS.name: No Future
PEARL_AMYTIS.flavor:
Asma's Keeper came with that Traveller in tow, asking for refuge. I should have turned them down... Instead I opened the Library for them. They were meant to be safe within its walls. Even he, blinded by his current folly, should have recognised the sanctity of this place.
How naive of me.

PEARL_ASMA.name: Positive Report
PEARL_ASMA.flavor:
Are my senses tricking me again? I've been looking out for so long. I don't know what is real and what is not anymore. Stars and corrupted spots on my sensors feel awfully similar. It's so hard to focus.
And yet.
And YET.
I think this is it. I finally found it. I need to share the news.
Our journey is over.

PEARL_HALYN.name: Beginning of the End
PEARL_HALYN.flavor:
We are stuck.
Whether by design, or by accident, we are now stuck in these motionless shells forever. Noden seems surprisingly calm about it, considering he's the first to be impacted, but he's nothing more than a fool. No one shall escape the consequences of these events.
The danger starts now, and it comes from ourselves. From the legacy of our fragile, frustrating and once mortal minds. We weren't meant to last more than a few centuries. Apathy, paranoia, dementia, frenzy... Those are symptoms our slow degeneration will spark, given time.
I can delay them, however. The first step will be to gain the ability to move once again...

PEARL_KHLIA.name: Final Instructions
PEARL_KHLIA.flavor:
It had to be done.
I'm sorry that this burden fell on you, Ati. But we couldn't continue like that.
With him gone, I feel blind now. Numb. I don't know where I am going. I can't hear the others. 
I'd be alone again, if not for you.
To be disconnected... It's so strange a sensation. One I haven't felt since my Embedding. Did I really use to live like that?
It is sort of scary. And sort of liberating.
But we cannot stay aimless forever.
I have one final task for you, and this is, perhaps, the most important one I ever gave you.
Please, I need the coordinates. 
Find them.

PEARL_LIHO.name: Our Fault
PEARL_LIHO.flavor:
Our fault.
Everything is-
Our fault.
Lura was under our care, and we failed her.
Our fault.
We couldn't protect the Travellers' dream from the machines.
Our fault.
We are disconnected now, but it was too late already. They lost everything.
Our fault.
Soon the cold will be setting in. We can feel it building up behind our walls, and there is nothing we can do to stop it.
Our fault.
They can't resist it. They won't resist it. Their despair is overwhelming. 
They don't have the will to live anymore, and it is our fault.

PEARL_NODEN.name: Premature Conclusion
PEARL_NODEN.flavor:
We can't land. The Vessel can't land. She can't take it. Redundant systems would all die in favour of the Library. Including us Pearls, and most of the machines.
Yet the Travellers won't listen to my warnings. They would sacrifice all units in order to finally reach their Promised Land. Was it... Was it something they expected from the beginning? Were they always going to leave us behind while they get to have a new home, a future?
Why do the machines always have to be the expendable ones?
I can accept my own demise. I was ready for it all these years ago, and I was denied it once already. But the death of the machines that carried the Vessel so far? The death of Shii, so ever patient, so ever caring towards even the smallest of the systems? It feels... so unjust.
I cannot accept it.
I can never accept it.
I will protect them all.

TXT_TRAVELLER_LOG1_TRANSLATED.name: Stargazing
TXT_TRAVELLER_LOG1_TRANSLATED.flavor:
I love stargazing. Everywhere around us, there's something to see. Light, colours, shapes, you name it. It made me realise how wrong things were back home. 
It shouldn't have taken boarding a spaceship to be able to watch the stars for the first time. They are a precious spectacle, a reminder the universe is infinitely vast and we are but a tiny speck of dust. A comforting thought, at least to me.
When we reach our new home, let's be sure to preserve a starry sky for our kids, alright?

TXT_TRAVELLER_LOG2_TRANSLATED.name: So Boring
TXT_TRAVELLER_LOG2_TRANSLATED.flavor:
You know how it's always sunny here? Always the right temperature, always the perfect summer weather? 
Well, it's  b o r i n g. 
I miss the rain. The ugly days. The cold and the dark. I miss that feeling you get with a hot cocoa, comfy plaid and soft music playing in the background while it pours like hell outside. 
Come on, tech guys. I know you read these logs. Give us a nice winter once in a while.

TXT_TRAVELLER_LOG3_TRANSLATED.description: Jump down through the pot in Aviaries Passepartout.
TXT_TRAVELLER_LOG3_TRANSLATED.name: No Promise
TXT_TRAVELLER_LOG3_TRANSLATED.flavor:
Adults can't stop talking about the Promised Land and how there will be no walls 
and the ceiling will be empty
and there will be lots of plants and even animals
and everything will be so big that you can get lost and not find your way home.
It's scary!! 
I don't want the Promised Land. I never promised anything! There is already a garden here and it's beautiful and alive and I can always get back home whenever I want. Mom says it's where I was born. 
Do we really have to go?

TXT_TRAVELLER_LOG4_TRANSLATED.description: Foundations, eastern bottom area. Hairpin the enemy.
TXT_TRAVELLER_LOG4_TRANSLATED.name: Grateful
TXT_TRAVELLER_LOG4_TRANSLATED.flavor:
To the six Voices, we are grateful.
We are grateful to the Blood, for the warmth he provides.
We are grateful to the Breath, for the air in our lungs.
We are grateful to the Eye, for the long watch over our Travel.
We are grateful to the Hand, for the tools she shapes.
We are grateful to the Spine, for the bonds we share through him.
We are grateful to the Heart, for the world around us.
May you keep on watching over us forever.

TXT_TRAVELLER_LOG5_TRANSLATED.name: No more
TXT_TRAVELLER_LOG5_TRANSLATED.flavor:
she isn't dead
she ISN'T dead
they say she is, but she's not
I bet she would like to be dead, because now she 
cannot
she's stuck in-between
my love
what did they do to you?
we cannot allow it to happen again
no more sacrifice
no more failures
not even to bring new voices
the ship can sail without them

TXT_TRAVELLER_LOG6_TRANSLATED.name: The Word of the Voices
TXT_TRAVELLER_LOG6_TRANSLATED.flavor: Heed the Word of the Voices, but do not seek their contact, for an impure touch will anger them and they will trap your soul in their white shell.

TXT_TRAVELLER_LOG7_TRANSLATED.name: Prayer to the Dead
TXT_TRAVELLER_LOG7_TRANSLATED.flavor:
Your journey ends here.
The Voices deemed you ready. They sent you to the Promised Land ahead of us. There your spirit shines as a beacon, lighting our way to you. 
We will now entrust your empty vessel to the eternal night, for you no longer need to be carried among the stars. 
We shall meet you again in the Promised Land.

BELL_TOWER_PASS_CITY.name: Bell Tower Visitor Pass (City)
BELL_TOWER_PASS_CITY.flavor: Come and witness the majestic toll of the last untouched relic of Earth, the Celestial Bell!

BELL_TOWER_PASS_GARDEN.name: Bell Tower Visitor Pass (Garden)
BELL_TOWER_PASS_GARDEN.flavor: Come and witness the majestic toll of the last untouched relic of Earth, the Celestial Bell!

BUNKER_KEY.name: Bunker Key
BUNKER_KEY.flavor: You hereby declare that you are aware of the risks inherent to the Vaults' industrial environment, and that you can only blame yourself for any personal shortfall, injury or death. - Dr Halyn

LURA.name: Lura's Seal
LURA.flavor: Cast away your old shell. Forget your material desires. Cut all ties with your past. You are a Traveller no more, for you now give your Voice to the Vessel.

MAINTENANCE_KEY.name: Old-fashioned Key
MAINTENANCE_KEY.flavor: This is what keys looked like in the olden times. Don't worry about how to use it, this replica is a fully functional electronic badge!

ROOTS_CORRIDOR.name: Silo Access Badge
ROOTS_CORRIDOR.flavor: For workers only. Do not lose your badge, it won't be reprinted!

SPIDY_KEY.name: Friendly Invitation
SPIDY_KEY.flavor: join us join us join us join us join us join us join us join us join us join us join us join us

SPINE_FRAGMENT.name: Fragment of Ailen, the Spine
SPINE_FRAGMENT.flavor: Sharp edges and smooth surface. As broken as the bonds between the Pearls.

5.description: #5 Canopy, east of Network Gate in a hidden area.

6.description: #6 Foundations, lower area, use the wind jet to go up.

0.description: #0 Southeast section of room west of <redacted> Network Gate (Promenade).

1.description: #1 Below <redacted> Network Gate (Promenade), eastern platforming area.

4.description: #4 Below <redacted> Network Gate (Promenade), western platforming area.

1.description: #1 The Shattered Spine, top eastern section.

3.description: #3 Above The Blood's Sanctum, after a boss fight.

4.description: #4 The Pit, east of the bottom elevator.

0.description: #0 Purchase from Mel (no req, 1 core 300 nacre)

1.description: #1 Purchase from Mel (no req, 1 core 300 nacre)

6.description: #6 Top of Bell Tower in a platforming area.

7.description: #7 East of the Bell Tower, in a platforming area.

8.description: #8 Manufactory, top of the glass tubes.

9.description: #9 East of the Promenade Tower, in a platforming area.

10.description: #10 East of the Nexus, under the Crystallizer room.

11.description: #11 East of the Nexus, Flora room. Southeast of the Crystallizer room.

12.description: #12 East of the Nexus, ledge in Haven.

13.description: #13 East of Vaults, halfway through Sawlong path. Climb up the Gloomwater.

14.description: #14 Western Dwellings, on a pointy ledge.

15.description: #15 Slingshot door (Splintering Dodge) in the western Vaults.

16.description: #16 East of Nexus, Slingshot door to the right of Haven ledge.

17.description: #17 The Pit, above the Network Gate.

18.description: #18 Bottom of Dwellings, in a Combat Room.

19.description: #19 Spine room, underneath the eastern passage.

20.description: #20 Western Metropolis, in a platforming area.

21.description: #21 Eastern Feral Undergrowth, to the east of the Nacre Basin.

23.description: #23 Vaults, drawer in top right of main room.

ANALYZER.name: Analyser
ANALYZER.flavor: Knowing your enemy is the first step to winning any battle.

MAINTENANCE_EXPERT.name: Maintenance Hack
MAINTENANCE_EXPERT.description: The Protective Coat repair at Nacre Basins is free.
MAINTENANCE_EXPERT.flavor: If you spend less Nacre in those basins, then you can spend more Nacre here. --Mel

SHIELD_INC.name: Protective Overlay
SHIELD_INC.description: Grants an additional layer of protection.
SHIELD_INC.flavor: -- WARNING -- External temperature under critical minimum. Reinforcement of defence systems recommended.

BIG_ENERGY_DRAIN.name: Energy Leecher
BIG_ENERGY_DRAIN.description: Large increase to energy recovered when attacking an enemy.
BIG_ENERGY_DRAIN.flavor: I try not to dwell on the ethics of that functionality.

ENERGY_EMPTY_ATTACK.name: Foolish Ideal
ENERGY_EMPTY_ATTACK.description: Damage inflicted on enemies increases when energy is not fully charged.
ENERGY_EMPTY_ATTACK.flavor: The Travellers were acoustic, while we are electric. If we can learn a lesson or two from them, then we can survive even the death of the Heart!

DECOY.name: Afterimage
DECOY.description: Using the Hairpin with [Hairpin] generates a decoy that enemies will target first. The decoy explodes after a short delay.
DECOY.flavor: Experiment #21: Using Energy Outbursts as Sensory Hallucinations to Distract Machines when I Want to Steal Cake from the Kitchens. --Halyn, 7 years old

CARLO_HOOK.name: Glitch Trail
CARLO_HOOK.description: Leaves a trail that hurts enemies after using the Hairpin on any target.
CARLO_HOOK.flavor: Experiment #146: Releasing an E.M.P. as a Means of Protection to Shake Off Pursuers when I Take a Peek in the Vaults --Dr Halyn, 17 years old

GLIDE_STATIC.name: Firefly
GLIDE_STATIC.description: Using the Sail with [Sail] generates a static storm around Mio that deals damage to enemies over time.
GLIDE_STATIC.flavor: Some Travellers believed that, when night came, the Firefly units would fly up to the sky to recharge the suns and bring back the dawn.

FAST_RECOVERY.name: Reduced Latency
FAST_RECOVERY.flavor: Excessive latency is the number one cause of death for crisis-management units!

MORE_SCRAPS.name: Effective Dismantlement
MORE_SCRAPS.description: Enemies leak a lot more Nacre Droplets when dying.
MORE_SCRAPS.flavor: We live in an enclosed world with limited resources. Recycling isn't preferable; it is vital.

COUNTER_ATTACK.name: Counter Measures
COUNTER_ATTACK.description: Dodging an attack with [Dodge] applies the "targeted" status to the enemy.
COUNTER_ATTACK.flavor: As they did unto us, so they shall receive.

HEAVY_ATTACK.name: Kinetic Thrust
HEAVY_ATTACK.description: The last attack of the combo deals more damage.

GOO_REVENGE.name: Defense Mechanism
GOO_REVENGE.description: Creates an explosion around Mio when she takes a hit.
GOO_REVENGE.flavor: Explosions have been reported all over the Vessel. Maybe we've gone a little overboard with this Modifier...

ORB_BLOCK.name: Splintering Dodge
ORB_BLOCK.description: Dodging an attack with [Dodge] generates an Energy Shard.
ORB_BLOCK.flavor: Unfortunately, Energy Shards are very unstable by themselves. Fortunately, I have plans here for a device that should be able to trap it locally. Imagine, Energy Shards so common that we could use them as simple lamp posts...

VAMPIRE.name: Extra-Coating Processor
VAMPIRE.description: Creates an extra layer of protection (non-stackable) for every 3 enemies defeated.
VAMPIRE.flavor: In the Vaults, you are just a tool for the Hand. Make sure to be the tool that outlasts the others.

HOOK_SLASH.name: Sharpened Hairpin
HOOK_SLASH.description: Grants the ability to slice enemies with [Attack] when using the Hairpin on them.

HUD.name: Self-Awareness
HUD.description: Displays Mio's status on the screen.
HUD.flavor: How could one even exist without being able to monitor their own condition? It would be like being a stranger to oneself.

LOOT_SUPER_SCRAPS.name: Portable Crystalliser
LOOT_SUPER_SCRAPS.description: Converts some Nacre Droplets dropped by enemies into Crystallised Nacre.
LOOT_SUPER_SCRAPS.flavor: I'll make a pendant out of these crystals, and then I'll store my memories of you inside, so that you never forget that I love you.

STAGGER_ATTACK.name: High-voltage Discharge
STAGGER_ATTACK.description: After a short delay, the next attack will automatically stun the target.
STAGGER_ATTACK.flavor: Experiment #97: Testing the Intake Capacity of Standard Vessel Units to Isolate their Breaking Point --Halyn, 13 years old

BERSERKER.name: The Hand's Greed
BERSERKER.description: Damage inflicted on enemies increases for each layer of protection that Mio has already lost.
BERSERKER.flavor: What I give with the right hand, I take back with all the others.

LAST_CHANCE.name: Makeshift Recovery
LAST_CHANCE.description: Quickly defeating an enemy that has hit Mio restores one extra layer of protection (non-stackable).
LAST_CHANCE.flavor: For something made on the spot, it's surprisingly handy.

ALEXANDERS_FATE.name: Alexander's Fate
ALEXANDERS_FATE.description: Nacre Droplets are no longer lost upon death.
ALEXANDERS_FATE.flavor: Some will say it's a pragmatic choice, others might call it cowardly.

PACIFIC.name: Asma's Will
PACIFIC.description: Enemies (bosses excluded) don't attack Mio as long as she doesn't strike first.
PACIFIC.flavor: I will never stop watching over you.

HEAL_GROUND.name: Gratitude
HEAL_GROUND.description: Restores an extra layer of protection (non-stackable) when Mio stays on the ground for a short time.
HEAL_GROUND.flavor: Don't tell anyone. I have a reputation to uphold.

KINETIC_CONVERSION.name: Pain Conversion
KINETIC_CONVERSION.flavor: You see a drawback. I see an opportunity.

ORB_RECOVERY.name: Defragmentation
ORB_RECOVERY.description: Getting hit by an enemy generates an Energy Shard.
ORB_RECOVERY.flavor: Each drawback is an opportunity to gather yourself.

BETTER_DODGE.name: Enhanced Dodge
BETTER_DODGE.description: Dodging attacks with [Dodge] has an increased timing.
BETTER_DODGE.flavor: We wanted to explore the 'dodge' space. Unfortunately, no one remembers what is on the other side.

HOOK_BERSERKER.name: Wild Cat
HOOK_BERSERKER.description: After using the Hairpin, the next attack will be a heavy strike that inflicts a lot more damage to enemies.
HOOK_BERSERKER.flavor: They were monsters lurking in the shadows, with eyes glowing in the dark. When they lept, it was already too late for you. No wonder they tamed our ancestors...

SPIDER_BERSERKER.name: Black Widow
SPIDER_BERSERKER.description: Damage inflicted on enemies temporarily increases while using the Striders.
SPIDER_BERSERKER.flavor: They clawed their ways into our worst nightmares centuries ago, and they still live there. Well, better in our heads than in the Vessel.

SCRAP_ATTACK.name: Nacre Overload
SCRAP_ATTACK.description: Damage inflicted on enemies increases for each Nacre Droplet carried. Each attack dealt to an enemy will use Droplets, but all Droplets will be recovered when the enemy dies.
SCRAP_ATTACK.flavor: Money is power. Power is ephemeral.

QUICK_RECHARGE.name: The Heart's Favourite
QUICK_RECHARGE.description: Energy recharges quicker when on the ground.
QUICK_RECHARGE.flavor: Usually, the Heart doesn't play favourite. But one unit in particular always was the exception.

FOUNTAIN_OVERLOAD.name: High-Risk Voucher
FOUNTAIN_OVERLOAD.description: Allows to purchase an extra layer of protection (non-stackable) at the Nacre Basins.
FOUNTAIN_OVERLOAD.flavor: The Wearer of this voucher has been recognised as a high-risk worker and is therefore authorised to use the advanced functions of the Nacre Basins.

DOUBLE_DAMAGES.name: Perfect State
DOUBLE_DAMAGES.description: High increase of the damage inflicted on enemies when all layers of protection are active.
DOUBLE_DAMAGES.flavor: When every system comes together, they become greater that the sum of all their parts.

GLIDE_BERSERKER.name: Bird of Prey
GLIDE_BERSERKER.description: Damage inflicted on enemies temporarily increases while using the Sail.
GLIDE_BERSERKER.flavor: The sun was their biggest ally, masking their deadly descent onto their prey. A good thing that there aren't any aboard the Vessel, considering the number of suns we have hanging here.

TURBO_GLIDE.name: Sunsail
TURBO_GLIDE.description: Increases gliding speed while using the Sail, but also increases its energy consumption.
TURBO_GLIDE.flavor: May the starlight push us in the right direction.

DRY_FOUNTAINS.name: Nacre Drought
DRY_FOUNTAINS.description: Increases the number of modifier slots, but Nacre Basins stay dry.
DRY_FOUNTAINS.flavor: Fasting is an old Traveller's tradition. It's said to help you open your ports and expand your processes. As for me, I think it just favours computing hallucinations.

KURO_CHARM.name: Imperfect Focus
KURO_CHARM.description: Increases the number of modifier slots, but the timing for dodging attacks with [Dodge] is reduced.
KURO_CHARM.flavor: The more you know, the harder it becomes to escape the truth.

LESS_SCRAPS.name: Resources Shortage
LESS_SCRAPS.description: Increases the number of modifier slots, but enemies drop fewer Nacre Droplets when defeated.
LESS_SCRAPS.flavor: I may be poor in material goods, but I am rich in mind and skill.

SHIELD_DEC.name: Thinner Frame
SHIELD_DEC.description: Increases the number of modifier slots, but removes one layer of protection.
SHIELD_DEC.flavor: Energy savings have to come from somewhere.

SLOW_ENERGY.name: Split Process
SLOW_ENERGY.description: Increases the number of modifier slots, but energy recharges more slowly.
SLOW_ENERGY.flavor: More brain power means more hunger.

DAREDEVIL.name: Oath to Ember
DAREDEVIL.description: Increases the number of modifier slots, but the damage received in combat are doubled.
DAREDEVIL.flavor: They pledged to protect her while she ran away. They kept their word, but at what cost...

GLASS_CANNON.name: Defective Core
GLASS_CANNON.description: Increases the number of modifier slots, but disables the Protective Coat entirely.
GLASS_CANNON.flavor: "Exposed" and "Free" are two sides of the same coin.

LIHO.name: Liho's Voice
LIHO.description: A voice that carries the weight of regret.

HALYN.name: Halyn's Voice
HALYN.description: A voice that carries the weight of ambition.

ASMA.name: Asma's Voice
ASMA.description: A voice that carries the weight of aging.

NODEN.name: Noden's Voice
NODEN.description: A voice that carries the weight of choice.

AMYTIS.name: Amytis' Voice
AMYTIS.description: A voice that carries the weight of indifference.
